# Carbon and Sulfur Analyzer - Government Tender Announcement

## Description

Natural Resources Canada (Canmet Materials) is soliciting a bid for the purchase of one (1) Carbon and Sulfur Analyzer (CSA) in accordance with the requirements detailed below.

## Mandatory Technical Criteria
To be eligible for contract award, the supplier must meet the following mandatory technical criteria:

1.  The CSA must be CSA or ULC approved with visible markings and certified by ESA.
2.  The equipment's noise level during operation must be less than 65dB at a distance of 12” from the equipment.
3.  The CSA must be a countertop design, with a depth not exceeding 32” and a weight not exceeding 310 lbs.
4.  The equipment must be capable of accommodating various shapes and sizes of samples (solids, wires, powders).
5.  The equipment must meet or exceed the requirements of all relevant international standards for Carbon and Sulfur analysis using the combustion-fusion technique.
6.  The equipment must be equipped with an independent oxygen lance to supply pure oxygen directly to the interior of the crucible to assist with complete combustion of the sample.
7.  The equipment must be interfaced with an analytical balance for sample weight measurement.
8.  The equipment must operate in conditions of 15 – 35°C, 20 – 80% relative humidity (non-condensing).
9.  The equipment must include a vacuum-assisted furnace chamber auto-cleaning after each analysis.

## Evaluation Criteria
The responsive bidder, who meets the mandatory technical criteria with the lowest aggregate price, will be recommended for contract award.

## Contract Requirements
The procured CSA will be used by Natural Resources Canada (Canmet Materials) to support its laboratory operations.

## Invitation to Bid
Only suppliers currently pre-qualified on Supply Arrangement E60PV-19EQUI have been invited to bid. Suppliers that do not have a Supply Arrangement for the supply of Laboratory and Scientific Equipment, Parts and Accessories, Services and Supplies with Public Works and Government Services Canada, cannot submit a bid.

The deadline for bid submission is **12 January 2024, at 14:00 – EST**. Late bids will not be accepted.

Note: This tender is reserved for holders of Supply Arrangement # E60PV-19EQUI only.
